title.value: Enhancing CTR prediction in Recommendation Domain with Search Query Representation
title.justification: The title is taken directly from the provided information.
title.quote: Enhancing CTR prediction in Recommendation Domain with Search Query Representation

extractions.description: This paper proposes a framework for improving click-through rate (CTR) prediction in the recommendation domain by leveraging user search query representations. The approach involves using user search query sequences from the search domain to predict item clicks in the recommendation domain. It incorporates contrastive learning and diffusion models to enhance data sparsity issues and improves overall prediction performance.

type.justification: The paper includes experimental analysis to demonstrate model performance, suggesting an empirical study.
type.quote: Experimental analysis demonstrates that our model outperforms state-of-the-art models in the recommendation domain.

name.justification: The paper focuses on improving click-through rate (CTR) predictions in recommender systems by utilizing search query information.
name.quote: Many platforms, such as e-commerce websites, offer both search and recommendation services simultaneously to better meet users’ diverse needs.

name.justification: The framework utilizes user search query representations, aligning with Information Retrieval.
name.quote: Existing approaches either overlook the shift in user intent between these domains or fail to capture the significant impact of learning from users’ search queries on understanding their interests.

name.justification: The paper introduces the QueryRec framework as a solution for enhancing CTR prediction.
name.quote: To address the aforementioned problem, we design a search-enhanced framework for CTR prediction named QueryRec.

is_contributed.justification: QueryRec is introduced in the paper as a novel framework.
is_contributed.quote: To address the aforementioned problem, we design a search-enhanced framework for CTR prediction named QueryRec.

is_executed.justification: There is no specific mention of execution environment (GPU/CPU) in the paper.

is_compared.justification: QueryRec's performance is compared to other models in experimental analysis.
is_compared.quote: Experimental analysis demonstrates that our model outperforms state-of-the-art models in the recommendation domain.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The model is introduced as a novel contribution, not as a reference to another paper.

name.justification: The dataset is used to analyze users' interest shifts between search and recommendation domains.
name.quote: we conducted an analysis based on KuaiSAR-small to determine if there is indeed an interest shift between the recommendation and search domains.

referenced_paper_title.value: KuaiSAR: A Unified Search And Recommendation Dataset
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is associated with the KuaiSAR papers referenced later in the document.
referenced_paper_title.quote: KuaiSAR [20] datasets include two versions: KuaiSAR-large and KuaiSAR-small.

name.justification: The dataset is used for model training and validation to assess performance across domains.
